document-id.name: KRØLL JENSEN ANNETTE E [DK], et al
KRØLL JENSEN ANNETTE E [DK], et al

abstract.p: A process for producing hydrogen comprising subjecting a gaseous mixture 48 of a hydrocarbon and steam, with a steam to carbon ratio of at least 0.9:1, to adiabatic pre-reforming in a pre-reformer 40, followed by autothermal reforming 46 to generate a reformed gas mixture 56. One or more water-gas shift stages 68 increase the hydrogen content of the reformed mixture. The hydrogen-enriched gas is cooled and condensed water separated prior to passing through a carbon dioxide separation unit 104 to produce a CO2 stream 110 and a crude hydrogen stream 112. The crude hydrogen stream is passed to a purification unit 114 to produce a purified hydrogen gas 116 and a fuel gas 122. The fuel gas is fed to fired heaters 30, 124 to heat process streams. By using the fuel gas as a fuel source, CO2 emissions may be minimised.
